column2: bunny, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: OK my review is a combo of the below:It works great for me!I have 2 blown disks and 2 ruptured disks in my lower back.I find 500mg is not enough.I will cut one in half. 800mg would work best for me.  Does not make me totally loopy. I can think and function on it--everyone is different.It alows me to walk,sit,ect.. with relaxed muscles which is half the battle of the pain.45 min is accurate to start feeling the effects.Alcohol does MAJORLY INTENSIFY the sleepy effect. Had a glass of wine and could barely keep my eyes open and it made me feel alittle dizzy (yes I only had 1 glass). I take the pil then lay down on a heating pad. After about an hour or so I can finally get to sleep.Don't take it on an empty stomach. My suggestion...grab one peice of toast. Again, everyone's different.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for muscle spasms due to injury and fibromalgia.  It works wonderful and will stop the spasms with little or no (for me) side effects.  You can function much better but have to be on guard that you don't do to much since you aren't feeling anything. Safe and works.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor switched me to this medication because the last muscle relaxer she prescribed made me feel drunk and disoriented. This medicine doesn't, so I'm pleased in that regard. However, the medicine doesn't really take the pain in my back away, like the other one did. I've been tempted to take two pills instead of one just to see if that relieves the pain, but I'm afraid of overdosing. Not very effective.

column2: vicki p, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months

column9: I was having back pain after a long day at work and it made it hard to continue my day. With the medication I can work my day through without dragging.

column2: TTDun1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine is good for me because I have a weak stomach.  So far I have not had any problems like I have with other muscle relaxers.  Seems to be good in that manner.  Not very strong though.  Only takes the edge off a little.  Definately has made me tired.  Alcohol ABSOLUTELY INTENSIFIES this side effect.  I recommend not driving while on it, especially if you're already sleepy.  My doctor gave me a really good tip...he said the medicine takes about 45 minutes to get into your system (into the blood stream), so 30 minutes after you take your dose, apply a heating pad or hot compress to the area of pain to get the medicine flowing better to where the pain is.  I have not had a chance to try this yet, but it totally makes sense.
